  • Element
jcomb.annotations

Annotation Type CombinationTest


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
 @TestTemplate
public @interface CombinationTest
    This annotation has to be used instead of the normal Test annotation from JUnit when the test method should use the combinatorial test engine. If needed only a subset of all the defined parameters in the class can be used for this test. The test method has to have input parameters of the corresponding type and order as defined via the index of the class parameters or the order of the defined subset. Example: 
     @Parameter(index = 0)
 private static Values parameter1 = new Values(1,2,3,4);
 
 @Parameter(index = 1)
 private static Values parameter2 = new Values("s1","s2,"s3");
 
 @CombinationTest
 void testMethod(int param1, String param2){
  ...
 }
 
 @CombinationTest(parameters = {1})
 void testMethod2(String param){
  ...
 }
    Author:
    Noah Zuch

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Algorithm algorithm
      A specific algorithm can be set, that should be used for the combinatorial test generation.
      int[] parameters
      If only a subset of parameters should be used for this test method they can be defined here as an array of there indices.

    • Element Detail

      • algorithm

        public abstract Algorithm algorithm
        A specific algorithm can be set, that should be used for the combinatorial test generation. Some algorithms need preconditions to run successfully. See the documentation in Algorithm for more info. The default value is Algorithm.ANY.
        Returns:
        the Algorithm to use for test generation
        Default:
        jcomb.core.Algorithm.ANY

      • parameters

        public abstract int[] parameters
        If only a subset of parameters should be used for this test method they can be defined here as an array of there indices. The order of the array overwrites the natural order of the parameter indices so the order of the input parameter of the test method has to match the here defined order! By default every defined Parameter in the class is used in the order of there indices.
        Returns:
        the parameters to use test generation.
        Default:
        {}
